intro: Plectranthus maddenii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes other aromatic plants like mint and sage. The plant is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to white. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light. Plectranthus maddenii is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its compact growth habit and attractive foliage.
